results.name: default/mysql-545b4cd7dd-lbp9c
results.details:
Error: Kubernetes is having trouble pulling the "mysql:latest" image from the container registry.

Solution: 
1. Check internet connectivity.
2. Verify the image name and tag.
3. Ensure Docker Hub is accessible.
4. Check Kubernetes node permissions.
5. Try a specific version tag instead of "latest".

results.name: default/wordpress-6f45748d6f-ss5lg
results.details:
Error: Kubernetes is having trouble pulling the "wordpress:latest" image from the container registry.

Solution: 
1. Check internet connectivity.
2. Verify the image name and tag.
3. Ensure Docker Hub is accessible.
4. Check for rate limits on Docker Hub.
5. Try pulling the image manually with `docker pull wordpress:latest`.

results.name: kube-system/kube-controller-manager-response-42-control-plane

error.Text: the last termination reason is Error container=kube-controller-manager pod=kube-controller-manager-response-42-control-plane

results.details:
Error: The kube-controller-manager pod on the control plane terminated with an error in the specified container.

Solution: 
1. Check pod logs: `kubectl logs kube-controller-manager-response-42-control-plane -c kube-controller-manager`.
2. Inspect recent changes or configurations.
3. Verify resource limits and dependencies.
4. Restart the pod: `kubectl delete pod kube-controller-manager-response-42-control-plane`.

results.name: kube-system/kube-scheduler-response-42-control-plane

error.Text: the last termination reason is Error container=kube-scheduler pod=kube-scheduler-response-42-control-plane

results.details:
Error: The kube-scheduler pod terminated due to an error in the kube-scheduler container.

Solution: 
1. Check kube-scheduler logs for detailed error info.
2. Verify the kube-scheduler configuration.
3. Ensure the container image is correct and up-to-date.
4. Restart the pod to apply any fixes.
